summary_points: 1. Verizon Communications Inc. announced on June 18, 2025, the pricing terms for exchange offers and cash offers to repurchase 10 series of its outstanding notes, with the exchange offers expiring the same day and the settlement date expected to be June 25, 2025.
2. The exchange offers involve a $2.5 billion cap on the maximum aggregate principal amount of new notes to be issued,  subject to a minimum issue requirement of $750 million that cannot be waived.

3.  The new notes issued in the exchange offers will mature on July 2, 2037, and will not be registered under the Securities Act, requiring an exemption from registration requirements for any sales in the United States.
1. Fortinet's June 13, 2025 annual meeting saw 87.04% of outstanding shares voted, with shareholders rejecting a proposal to separate the Chairman and CEO roles.
2.  Shareholder votes to elect directors ranged from 529,552,302 to 584,338,096 votes for, with significant numbers of votes against and abstentions across all nominees.
3. Deloitte & Touche LLP was ratified as Fortinet's independent registered accounting firm for the fiscal year ending December 31, 2025, receiving 617,257,742 votes for and 46,421,264 votes against.
1.  There is no human-readable information in the provided text excerpt.
1. Targa Resources Corp. completed a $1.5 billion underwritten public offering of senior notes due 2030 and 2036 on June 18, 2025.
2.  The net proceeds from the offering will be used to redeem 6.500% Senior Notes due 2027 issued by Targa Resources Partners LP and for general corporate purposes.
3. A legal opinion from Vinson & Elkins L.L.P. confirms the legality of the securities issuance, subject to several specified conditions and limitations.
1. Cathleen Benko retired from Nike's Board of Directors on June 13, 2025, effective at the 2025 annual shareholder meeting, and will not be standing for re-election.
2.  This filing is an 8-K report, indicating a current report filed with the SEC, concerning significant events such as changes in corporate governance.
3. No specific future impacts or risks are mentioned in this section of the filing beyond the departure of a director.
1.  A $4.5 million net loss was realized in fiscal year 2025 from reverse treasury locks entered into in November 2024 to manage interest rate fluctuations related to tender offers.
2.  The gross notional value of outstanding commodity derivative contracts increased from $787.7 million in fiscal year 2024 to $1,698.1 million in fiscal year 2025.
3.  Approximately $12.5 million of a net pre-tax loss from terminated interest rate contracts will be recognized over the next 12 months (as of June 18, 2025).

1. At Regeneron Pharmaceuticals' 2025 Annual Meeting of Shareholders (June 13, 2025), a proposal to amend the Company’s Certificate of Incorporation to eliminate supermajority vote requirements was not approved.

2.  The proposal to amend Article IV, Section 2(e)(8) of Regeneron's Certificate of Incorporation, relating to mandatory Class A stock conversion upon transfer, received 0 votes in favor and 18,081,400 votes against.
3. The proposal to amend Article VI of the Company’s Certificate of Incorporation, relating to the removal of directors for cause, received 85,490,182 votes for and 20,360,243 votes against.

1. Steel Dynamics, Inc. issued second-quarter 2025 earnings guidance of $2.00 to $2.04 per diluted share on June 18, 2025, down from $2.72 in the second quarter of 2024 and up from $1.44 in the first quarter of 2025.
2.  A $32 million non-cash write-off of consumable assets reduced Steel segment pretax earnings in the second quarter of 2025.
3. The company expects to begin shipping aluminum material from its new Mississippi mill mid-2025.
1. Progressive Corp's net income for May 2025 was $1,065 million, a 353% increase year-over-year.
2.  Year-to-date (through May 31, 2025), Progressive Corp's net premiums written increased by 15% to $35,677 million.
3.  Progressive anticipates higher premium growth in June 2025 to offset a prior month's reporting nuance, but expects second-quarter 2025 growth to remain unaffected.

1. Trimble Inc.'s 2025 annual meeting of stockholders on June 17, 2025, resulted in the election of nine directors and the approval of executive compensation and the appointment of KPMG as the independent registered public accounting firm.
2.  Significant shareholder votes were withheld for several director elections, with the highest number of withheld votes being 28,242,494 for Meaghan Lloyd.
3. KPMG's appointment as the independent registered public accounting firm is effective for the current fiscal year, ending January 2, 2026.

1. Best Buy Co., Inc. held its Regular Meeting of Shareholders on June 13, 2025, where shareholders elected directors and ratified the appointment of Deloitte & Touche LLP as the independent registered public accounting firm for the fiscal year ending January 31, 2026.
2.  A shareholder proposal to support shareholder right to act by written consent was rejected by shareholders, receiving only 11,968,421 votes in favor out of 185,953,615 votes cast.

3.  Several other shareholder proposals regarding executive compensation, an Omnibus Incentive Plan amendment, and reports on LGBTQIA+ inclusion and climate transition plans were also voted on and approved or rejected; however, the exact number of votes for and against each are provided in the filing.
